page.title: 01The village of Laggan bridge
page.content: The coordinates 0260-0792 contain the central area of the rambling highland parish of Laggan in the Badenoch and Strathspey district of Highland Region .Within these 12 squared kilometres are found church,school,surgery and shop.The village is a community of integrated people in a scattered rural setting.The hamlet is surrounded by the Monadhliath mountains and through it flows the young river Spey over which spans the 1985 concrete and steel,fourth LAGGAN BRIDGE,which gives the village its name. Laggan bridge sits on the A86 main road west to Fort William and guards the approach to General Wade's military road-the Corrieyairack pass-to Fort Augustus. The population of the given area is 125,but this decreases steadily as young people leave to seek work.
